question: A scientist wants to produce virus-free plant in tissue culture. Which part of the plant will he use as an explant?
(a) Mature stem
(b) Axillary meristem
(c) Apical meristem
(d) Mesophyll cells
explanation: Apical and axillary meristems are generally free of viruses due to lack of vascular supply and rapid division. Hence, they are used for recovering virus-free plants.
